entry.title: When did you know your parents were one of the good ones?
entry.content:
When did you know your parents were one of the good ones?

Jean-Marie ValheurÂ , married, father of threeDec 4

792.6k Views Â· 20.1k Upvotes

When I went to the house of my richest friend. I was in elementary school at the time. The boyâ€™s family lived in an enormous mansion. It was grand. It was glorious. Every nook and cranny of that building seemed to exude power, wealth, success. Walking up to the main door, I was utterly in awe of the size ofâ€¦ everything.

Then I went inside. And it wasâ€¦ empty. Not literally empty, there were chairs, sofas, the largest television set I had ever seen and some lamps. But the house had no books. The house had few pictures. And there were no parents to be seen.

I asked were my friendsâ€™ father was? At work, the answer went. He was always at work. His mother was â€œsickâ€, on bed with a headache.

Every time I was there, and I was there five or six times, dad was away at work, mom was sick with a headache. Looking back Iâ€™m almost certain the woman was an alcoholic. The man a workaholic. My friend was raised more or less by his older siblings.

Our house was small. Our families deeply involved. Life was simpleâ€¦ but it felt full. Theirs, though outwardly grand, felt empty. Just visiting that eery house a handful of times reminded me of how good I had it.

â–Œè¯„è®º:

Edie:

My favorite place to live while growing up was with my Grandmother. She had a small barely 1,200 ft farmette w/1 bathroom. Many of my aunts and uncles (5 of them) still lived at home and a cousin who was my age also lived with her. The house was crowded, loud and full of love, laughs and great food. It was absolute bliss for me.

Jean-Marie Valheur:

I feel you! My own grandparentsâ€™ home, too, was a magical place. It was big. But full. So many items, so many photos, so many artifacts, each with their own unique story. There were always people going in and out, neighbors dropping by, uncles visiting, cousins parking the bikes in the drive way and relaxing in the sun in the garden behind their houseâ€¦ a magical place, a grandparentsâ€™ home. Donâ€™t know how that works. It somehow just is.

entry.title: What is the biggest life lesson you have ever learned?
entry.content:
What is the biggest life lesson you have ever learned?

Reven Lee, M.S. in Psychology & Consulting, The Ohio State University (Graduated 2017)

74.7k Views Â· 1.4k Upvotes

  1. Most people wonâ€™t support you until they see itâ€™s popular to support you.

  2. When making any major life decision, remember: If itâ€™s not a â€œFxck Yesâ€, then itâ€™s a â€œNo.â€

  3. You are not supposed to be the same person you were a year, month, day, or even five seconds ago. You are designed to grow.

  4. The most powerful way to win an argument is by asking questions. It can make people see the flaws in their logic.

  5. Just because you donâ€™t share it on social media, doesnâ€™t mean youâ€™re not up to big things.

  6. Live it and stay low key. Privacy is everything.

  7. One manâ€™s â€˜nah you require too muchâ€™ is another manâ€™s â€˜thatâ€™s all you need?â€™ Donâ€™t settle. You can find better ones.

entry.title: I forgot to scan my one banana from Walmart and I realized it after I came home. Do I go back? Will I get in trouble?
entry.content:
I forgot to scan my one banana from Walmart and I realized it after I came home. Do I go back? Will I get in trouble?

John K Williamsson, Lives in United Federation of Planets (1951â€“present)Updated Dec 12

4M Views Â· 5.8k Upvotes

May I make a suggestion that will help the environment?

Call the store on the phone and apologize, say that you noticed when you got home that one banana did not get scanned.

Ask if you can pay for that banana the next time you are in the store.

I bet the manager tells you to forget about it.

personal anecdote

One time I was at Piggly Wiggly for one item. After getting the syrup, I realized I didnâ€™t have my wallet. I asked a manager who knew me by name if I could take it and pay for it the next day. He was happy to give me permission.

The next day, I went to a register, asked them to ring me up for the syrup without my having it there. She did. I showed the receipt to Mr. Rogers, yes thatâ€™s his name, and he smiled.

â–Œè¯„è®º:

S Hosain:
While in college, a friend and I bought a bunch of items at a supermarket to make dinner for about 6 or 7 people. After we left to walk back, I glanced at the bill and realized that it was way too low.

The cashier had scanned everything in front of us - we heard the beeps and tones, etc., but many items just had not made it to the total. As I recall, we had been undercharged about 30% to 40%.

We walked back and spoke to the manager. After he realized that we were not complaining about being overcharged or that the cashier was making errors (we were very clear about that!), he went over the register and realized that it wasnâ€™t working properly. I guess many people had paid less than they should have - certainly that day!

He shut the register down, thanked us, and waved us out! As college students with a tight budget, this certainly helped the dinner cost out for all of us!

Honesty is the right approach.

entry.title: What should we do?
entry.content:
My teenager wants only an Apple phone. We tried to explain that we canâ€™t afford it, and she stopped speaking with us. What should we do?

Tawni Doliveira

659.9k Views Â· 2.7k Upvotes

When I was 7, I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. I was in 2nd grade. My mom decided to get me a flip phone through Tracfone to text her if my blood sugar drops or if the nurse doesnâ€™t show up to give me my insulin dose.

Every other year after that I got a new Tracfone for Christmas. When I turned 12 or 13, I asked my mom for a newer, better phone. I had just moved to the high school (7th-12th grade) and everyone else had nice iPhones. I knew my mom couldnâ€™t afford an iPhone so I searched eBay for any phone that would do more than a cheap Tracfone.

At my school, teachers allow students to use a phone to search things, take pictures of dissections or powerpoints, or do our online assignments. I wanted to be able to be like everyone else and not have to go to get a teacher to unlock the room to the laptops to be able to do what others do or have to use a dictionary and have homework because it took too long to find the definitions.

I found a cheap android phone by the company Blu and my mom bought it for me. I loved it. My mom couldnâ€™t afford data so I used the schoolâ€™s WiFi.

About 2 years later, I wanted an iPhone. I got bullied for being poor and having a phone that became slow and was considered cheap. My mom got me a refurbished iPhone 6s Plus for Christmas 2016. Iâ€™m still using this phone and I love it.

Yes, Iâ€™d LOVE to have the newest iPhone but Iâ€™m very thankful to have this phone. My family hasnâ€™t had an income for 4 years yet my mom figured out a way to get me a better phone that would last a while.

Iâ€™m NOT telling you that this is what you should do. What Iâ€™m saying is ask her why she thinks she needs an iPhone. Ask her why she feels that way. Try to compromise with her. But hear her out. Teenagers often feel as if their feelings are invalid and that we donâ€™t have good points.

Have a conversation, donâ€™t yell or raise your voice or have an attitude that screams â€œIâ€™m better than you and only my points and views are validâ€. It makes us more angry because our side of the conversation isnâ€™t being heard.

All Iâ€™m saying is listen to her. Everything will work out â¤ï¸

Find one Used or refurbishedâ€¦ lower modelâ€¦ etcâ€¦ it doesnt have to be the X

entry.title: What are the simplest things one can do to make oneself happier?
entry.content:
What are the simplest things one can do to make oneself happier?

Brad Einarsen, social marketer, insights collector, Written Nov 8, 2012 Â· Featured in Lifehacker

178k Views Â· 61.3k Upvotes

When I was in a dark period I instituted a simple rule that changed my life.

Rule:
When I arrive home from work, the very first thing I tell my wife is the best thing that happened that day.

No exceptions. No complaining. Just the best thing that day, even if it was just a good cup of coffee. This had the effect of starting our evening off on a positive note and it changed our relationship.

entry.title: What was the best relationship advice you ever got?
entry.content:
What was the best relationship advice you ever got?

Zeeshan Mushtaq, Iâ€™m living. Learning. Discovering.

357.7k Views Â· 12.3k Upvotes

A big, big thank you to my ex for showering me with these beautiful pieces of advice.

  • Never date someone youâ€™re not attracted to. If youâ€™re confused, itâ€™s a NO.
  • Never date someone who has recently come out of a break-up. He/She might be on a rebound. In fact, in most of the cases, they are.
  • Never date someone whoâ€™s not emotionally strong as you. Youâ€™ll be the one to suffer.
  • Donâ€™t rush things. Rushing things will only lead to more complications. Start slow. Discover each other.
  • If your partner has lied to you on small things, he/she is capable of lying to you on more big things as well. Immediately leave them.
  • Lack of communication destroys a relationship. Always communicate about your problems with your partner. Try to sort them out.
  • And lastly, donâ€™t confuse lust with love.

Peace

â–Œè¯„è®º:

Neil Barembaum:
I would add two more, just as basic as these. Never date someone who is with someone else, even if they are willing to leave them for you â€” especially if they leave them for you. If they leave them for you, they will leave you for the next person.
Never date someone because you think it is your last chance. There will always be another.

entry.title: How do married people stay in love with their spouse when they are old, wrinkled, and grey?
entry.content:
How do married people stay in love with their spouse when they are old, wrinkled, and grey?

Terry Melvin, Lives in Tacoma, WA (1953â€“present)10mo

1.2M Views Â· 33.9k Upvotes

Let me answer this with my own anecdote.

My wife has had medical problems that have caused her to lose her figure. She is now very thin and wrinkled, and in the past year sheâ€™s lost all her teeth. She has dentures but usually wonâ€™t wear them when sheâ€™s at home.

Weâ€™ve been together for just short of 41 years now.

Anyway, one day she was sitting on the couch folding clothes, so I sat down on the couch next to her and gathered her in my arms. That beautiful ( though toothless) smile was still there, as was the light in her eyes that has never dimmed.

And I held her and realized, â€œmy God I will always love this womanâ€.

And above all, in those eyes I saw that she feels the same about old, arthritic and wrinkled me.

entry.title: In Chinese culture, how common is it to regularly say, "I love you" to family?
entry.content:
In Chinese culture, how common is it to regularly say, â€œI love youâ€ to family?

Dakota Lim, Updated February 29, 2016

289.9k Views Â· 1.8k Upvotes

Very common to hear parents say â€œI love youâ€ in the Chinese culture. BUT, these words must be translated. Here is the Chinese to English translation of
â€œI love youâ€:

Words
â€œHave you eaten today?â€
â€œate!â€
â€œEat some more!â€
â€œHave this soup it will build strong blood.â€

Actions
Mothers will give the best pieces of meat to their children.

Parents whose children are studying at universities will wonder and worry if their children are healthy or coming down with a cold or flu. They will make phone calls to ask their children if they are having enough to eat.

Mothers will receive hand-me-down childrenâ€™s clothing from friends and relatives and will take them apart and sew them into astonishing clothing that their children will like wearing.

Parents will continue to wear broken down shoes and slippers so their children can have shoes that fit well to wear to school so their feet wonâ€™t hurt while studying.

If you tell Chinese parents your friends donâ€™t have enough money to eat they will say, â€œBring them home for dinner, I will make good soup for them.â€ And will place the best pieces of meat on their plates just as they do for their own children.

They will make deep sacrifices to pay for books, school supplies, and tuition so their children will be able to have a safe and flourishing future through education. (Can you see the vision that comes from their heart?)

Parents even express their love openly when introducing their children to people. The tone of their voice says, â€œI love youâ€ when they say, â€œHe/she is my son/daughter, he/she went to XXX college.â€ The pride in their voices say, â€œI love them so much, they are my life. I live for them.â€

Can you feel their love?

entry.title: How do I impress my boss?
entry.content:
How do I impress my boss?

Asim Qureshi, January 14, CEO Jibble.io - the employee time clock app

61.4k Views Â· 2.5k Upvotes

Next time you have a question for your boss, do the following.

Ask the question, but also answer it as best you can, and give your reasoning.

So, instead of, â€œHey Asim, what shall I tell Jake?â€

It should be, â€œHey Asim, what shall I tell Jake? I suggest we agree to his terms because I feel if we push him any further itâ€™ll just delay things by weeks, possibly months. The last time we made a change it took us 7 weeks to get sign off.â€

Look for small ways in which you can add value. And make it a habit.

Unsurprisingly, she doesnâ€™t roll her eyes. Her name is Laura. We collaborate a lot on life and work decisions.

Sheâ€™s an editor for several academic journals so sheâ€™s always great at giving me feedback about my stuff. Sheâ€™s not afraid to tell me when my writing sucks and needs work. It makes me better at what I do.

entry.title: What was the best relationship advice you ever got?
entry.content:
What was the best relationship advice you ever got?

Sean Kernan

345.9k Views Â· 28k Upvotes

Just stay busy.

If you are breaking up, stay busy, keep your mind on other things. Staying busy makes the time fly by, and time flying by is the ticket to healing.

If your relationship is 50/50, on the rocks, maybe ending, stay busy, focus on your own life, if you come off as desperate and waiting for his/her attention it doesnâ€™t do you any favors in being more attractive.

If you are single, again, stay busy, get out and do things, thatâ€™s how you meet people.

The worst thing you can do is lie around and wallow in your own loneliness and misery. I learned this the hard way.

Stay busy.

entry.title: What is life like at age 45?
entry.content:
What is life like at age 45?

Alexander Finnegan, I prune bushes with a chainsaw.Dec 26

12.7M Views Â· 7.3k Upvotes

  1. You see classmates on Facebook you havenâ€™t seen since high school, and you are shocked at the middle age person who inhabited their bodies.
  2. Then you look in the mirror and realize they say that about you, too.
  3. Your mind is as sharp as ever, and you feel like you have learned a few things, too, maybe even a bit of wisdom.
  4. But you feel more aches and pains. You donâ€™t recover from hard work as quickly. I developed inflammatory arthritis at 27 which turned me into an 88 year old, so I suppose my experience may be unique.
  5. You have noticed that women age better than men. And that includes you.
  6. You consider how long it took to get to 45, and if you make it to 90, then you get to redo all you have already experiencedâ€”the glass is indeed only half empty.
  7. You are too old to be a sports star, but very young for a politician.
  8. You take care of children while caring for ailing parents. It is a very stressful time. Very stressful. And if your parents are gone, you grieve them. You even miss the hard times and would like them back because you still were a son or daughter. Now youâ€™re just a parent. Or not.
  9. You no longer can use youth as an excuse for doing dumb shit. But you are probably not interested in doing crazy shit anymore, either. Why? Because you are 45.

How well people age is down to genetics, diet, lifestyle and presentation. Frankly most men make little too no effort on their appearance and look dreadful when they donâ€™t need to. But since most men arenâ€™t as judged on their appearance as women, they arenâ€™t as incentivised. Plus men in manual labour work in harsh conditions that prematurely age them.

entry.title: What was the best piece of relationship advice you were given by your parents or another adult?
entry.content:
What was the best piece of relationship advice you were given by your parents or another adult?

Dushka Zapata, I also write about life on Instagram

109.6k Views Â· 8.2k Upvotes

One afternoon a long time ago (we must have been around fourteen years old) a friend of mine was talking to his dad.

â€œI am in love with a girlâ€ he said, â€œand Iâ€™d like to know how to keep her by my side.â€

â€œYou canâ€™tâ€ his dad said. â€œYou canâ€™t keep her. The best you can do is give her whatever she lacks.â€

â€œLike, gifts? Like what?â€

â€œNo, noâ€ said his dad. â€œI am not talking about stuff. I am talking about how she feels about her place in her life. Does she go through a lot of uncertainty? Give her stability. Does she feel in any way trapped? Give her freedom. Does she feel she does not matter? Give her the best quality of your attention. Does she feel things are always turbulent? Give her peace.â€

I have thought about this advice for decades, and the distinction between â€œcompletingâ€ someone and providing a counterpoint in their life.

The most fortunate relationships are a natural match between what a person lacks and what the other cannot wait to give.

entry.title: What are some hacks that everyone should know?
entry.content:
What are some hacks that everyone should know?

Elizabeth Collins

423.6k Views Â· 15.3k Upvotes

  1. When you sign up for anything online, put the websiteâ€™s name as your middle name. That way when you receive spam/advert email, you will know who sold your information.

  2. If youâ€™re on a first date and arenâ€™t connecting with the other person or feel theyâ€™re dull, ask them what job theyâ€™d choose if money wasnâ€™t an issue.

  3. If you want to be an effective communicators, let others talking about themselves and their interests.

  4. Do not try to be the man your father would want you to be. Be the man you would like your son to be be. It more clearly defines your own convictions, desires, goals, and motivates you to be your best.

  5. Pay Attention to the smell of your home when you come back from a trip - thatâ€™s what it smells like to guests all the time, you just get used to it.

  6. No matter how much your workplace pushes â€œteam buildingâ€ and â€œfamily cultureâ€ - remember, theyâ€™re not your friends and itâ€™s still a workplace.

  7. If youâ€™re stuck on an annoying call, put your phone on airplane mode instead of just hanging up. The other person will see â€œcall failedâ€ instead of â€œcall endedâ€.

  8. If you want to learn a new language, figure out the 100 most frequently used words and start with them. Those words make up about 50% of everyday speech, and should be a very solid basis.

entry.title: What is one example of manipulation?
entry.content:
What is one example of manipulation?

Savas Abdulhamid Cicekci

782.5k Views Â· 34.4k Upvotes

When the children passed an old house on their way home from school, they were always rubbing their sticks on the balcony railing and enjoying the sound. The older owner, who had been bothered by the noise for a long time, had a really good idea instead of scolding the kids.

He called the children over to him: â€œChildren, the noise you make sounds very nice, Iâ€™ll give you a pound a day if you keep going like this.â€ So he gave the kids a pound a day.

In the second week he called the children over again: â€œChildren, my money is scarce, I can only give you fifty pence, not a pound.â€

Now three weeks had passed and the old man called the children over to him for the last time: â€œChildren, unfortunately I have no money, so I canâ€™t give you any more.â€ The children: â€œNo money, no noiseâ€ and so they stopped rubbing the sticks on the balcony railing.

entry.title: When did you realise that you had grown up?
entry.content:
When did you realize that you had grown up?

Anagha Manoharan, Realizations are harder after the realizations !

124k Views Â· 11.8k Upvotes

My first job was that of a school teacher, with a salary package of 67$ per month. I worked there for one year, and to my own surprise, I saved my entire salary. Not for one month, but for one whole year.

No exception, every single penny saved, suppressing all the urges to buy anything for myself for one whole year.

And at the end of one year, I had 804$ in my account. Using which, I bought a couch and a dining table to my home, which was a long time dream of my mom. That was a moment when I watched my dad helping the truck driver to carry the furniture inside, and my mom are excited.

And thatâ€™s when I had this epiphany Damn I grew up :)

entry.title: Why do we need to study?
entry.content:
Why do we need to study?

Rajan Singh, CEO ConceptOwl, Ex-IPS, IITian, Wharton MBA

180.2k Views Â· 15.1k Upvotes

Two months ago, I asked a bunch of class 10th kids in a Trivandrum school: â€œWhy do we have to study Quadratic(äºŒæ¬¡çš„) equations and all this Maths you are going through? Your parents also studied these things, but are they using it?â€

You must have seen the delight in the studentsâ€™ eyes that someone finally asked this question!

Some of them said, â€œYes sir, we also wonder why all it is needed. But it is in the syllabus(æ•™å­¦å¤§çº²) - so we have to study.â€

Here is what I told them.

"When you go to a gym, you lift weights or do biceps curls(äºŒå¤´è‚Œèœ·æ›²), bench press(å§æ¨), or things like that. Why do you do that? In real life, how often do you have to do a biceps curl like movement to lift something?

The reason we do these exercises is to build our strength and stamina so that we can respond to any situation where we need physical strength. Even more importantly, it improves our overall health parameters and quality of life.

Similarly, the reason we study maths or any other subject is that they help build our mental muscle, develop logical thinking, and help us make sense of the world by recognizing patterns.

By studying, we are able to build mental models about the world, so that we can respond to situations more smartly than a monkey or an ape(å¤§çŒ©çŒ©) would do."

That, in a nutshell, is my answer to this question.

I also hope that we encourage our children to ask more of these questions and engage them in a meaningful discussion so that we produce thinking citizens, and not compliant robots.

entry.title: What is a waste of time?
entry.content:
What is a waste of time?

Chetan Ghodeswar, Government College of Engineering, Jalgaon (2019)

104.4k Views Â· 3.6k Upvotes

  1. Love is a waste of time. Specially If you fall in love before the age of 22, it is a waste of time. [check the comments below aimed to this one]
  2. Just talking with your friends about your crush or your friendâ€™s one is a waste of time.
  3. Excessively worrying about the future is a waste of time.
  4. Advising People is a waste of time. None is going to follow your advise ,people do what they want to do.
  5. Staring at girls is a waste of time.
  6. To see WhatsApp status updated of others is a waste of time. Itâ€™s always better to mute them.
  7. Debate or discussion (discussion always turns into debate) on politics is a waste of time.
  8. Scrolling Ins and Facebook page is a waste of time.
  9. Attending EVERY lecture in college is a waste of time.
  10. So, If you like it ,then upvote it. Upvoting to this answer is not a waste of time.

â–Œè¯„è®º:

Tulip Bradyï¼š

I agree with all except for the 1st one. Love is the only thing in life that is definitively NOT a waste of time. Young love can last. Love is the one thing you should put all your energy into, or most. Iâ€™m talking self love, family love, couple love, stranger love. It is the foundation of Human nature.

Itâ€™s the misconception that itâ€™s a waste time that makes it fleeting for most. If you know the true meaning of love then you know it is of the utmost important.

Gurmeet Singhï¼š

In some cases maturity not comes with age. It comes with incident. Maturity is core element for successful love. Here I am talking about mental maturity.

entry.title: What kind of people will not succeed in life?
entry.content:
What kind of people will not succeed in life?

Akram Khan, lived in 10 Countries and Travelled to 35

427.8k Views Â· 32.3k Upvotes

Some intelligent minds have quoted tons of valuable information under this question. Therefore, I would like to go the different way.

What kind of people will not succeed in life?

Well, as an answer to this question, I would say:

Once there was an old blacksmith who was famous for making the best swords in the country.

The soldiers came to him from different cities, even from distant borders and he made magnificent weapons for all of them.

And the buyers, then boasted of their military achievements - everyone was returning from campaigns with success.

One day a young guy came to him and said:

- Master, please, make the best sword in the world, I want to go on campaign with King. Can you make it?

- Sure, I can but it will take 1 year to make it

- 1 year is too long

- But you have to wait, otherwise, it wonâ€™t be the best sword in the world.

The young guy agreed to come after a year.

The blacksmith said, â€œMeanwhile, you must learn war skills from a reputed masterâ€.

The young man returned after a year. Blacksmith handed him his sword.

During the war, this man showed high war skills and conquered all of his targets.

After sometime, he returned to the blacksmith to say thanks for the best sword.

Blacksmith said,

â€œItâ€™s not the sword that won the battles. Itâ€™s your fighting skills. You could do this with any other sword as well. I made this sword in just 2 days but I wanted you to learn extraordinary war skills, thatâ€™s why I told you to come after a yearâ€

What kind of people will not succeed?

  • The one who doesnâ€™t know, what he/she needs for success.
  • The one, who, instead of learning the required skills, focuses on proving his/her (fake) success to others, probably wonâ€™t succeed.
  • The one, who, continuously thinks, if I were handsome or if I were tall or if I were born in White-house or if my father were a businessman, then I would have, for sure, been a badass successful person on this planet, Probably, wonâ€™t succeed.

If one spends sufficient time in learning, and never gives up, whatever, the conditions will be, I bet, no one can stop him/her from becoming successful.

Good luck!

entry.title: What is the best thing you came across on the Internet today?
entry.content:
What is the best thing you came across on the Internet today?

Akshay Som, 19h ago PhD, IIT Kanpur

36.3k Views Â· 1.7k Upvotes

During a robbery in America, the bank robber shouted to everyone in the bank: â€œDonâ€™t move. The money belongs to the State. Your life belongs to you.â€

Everyone in the bank laid down quietly. This is called â€œMind Changing Conceptâ€. Changing the conventional way of thinking.

When a lady lay on the table provocatively, the robber shouted at her: â€œPlease be civilized! This is a robbery and not a rape!â€

This is called â€œBeing Professionalâ€, Focus only on what you are trained to do!

When the bank robbers returned home, the younger robber (MBA-trained) told the older robber (who has only completed Year 6 in primary school): â€œBig brother, letâ€™s count how much we got.â€

The older robber rebutted and said: â€œYou are very stupid. There is so much money it will take us a long time to count. Tonight, the TV news will tell us how much we robbed from the bank!â€

This is called â€œExperienceâ€, Nowadays, experience is more important than paper qualifications!

After the robbers had left, the bank manager told the bank supervisor to call the police quickly. But the supervisor said to him: â€œWait! Let us take out $10 million from the bank for ourselves and add it to the $70 million that we have previously embezzled from the bankâ€.

This is called â€œSwim with the tideâ€, Converting an unfavorable situation to your advantage!

The supervisor says: â€œIt will be good if there is a robbery every month.â€

This is called â€œKilling Boredomâ€, Personal Happiness is more important than your job.

The next day, the TV news reported that $100 million was taken from the bank. The robbers counted and counted and counted, but they could only count $20 million. The robbers were very angry and complained: â€œWe risked our lives and only took $20 million. The bank manager took $80 million with a snap of his fingers. It looks like it is better to be educated than to be a thief!â€

This is called â€œKnowledge is worth as much as gold!â€

The bank manager was smiling and happy because his losses in the share market are now covered by this robbery.

This is called â€œSeizing the opportunityâ€ Daring to take risks!

So who are the real robbers here?

entry.title: What are some of the best moments of humanity?
entry.content:
What are some of the best moments of humanity?

Doha Hemida, Tue Student

39.1k Views Â· 1.5k Upvotes

This photo is of a man wanting to jump off a bridge in London. He was talked down by absolute strangers who proceeded to hold him for an hour until help arrived.

They huddled close to him and reminded him how valuable he was. How much they needed him. When we start showing this type of selflessness and compassion to people who struggle with addiction, we will start seeing change.

Love each other, yâ€™all.

â–Œè¯„è®º:

Alamiin Si:
I feel this so deeplyâ€¦ I love this!

Johannes Maritz:
Moments like these should be happening more, and petty hate because of different political opinions should become less. Unfortunately, humans fight all the time.

entry.title: What should I start doing in my twenties so I have nothing to regret at 40?
entry.content:
What should I start doing in my twenties so I have nothing to regret at 40?

Yannick Duchscher, Blogger Writing Copies (2018-present)

201.5k Views Â· 5.1k Upvotes

Health

  • Get your health on point.
  • Remove 90% of the sugar you consume - Ideally 100%.
  • Have a physical activity twice per week. No, watching TV isnâ€™t one.
  • Learn the basics on nutrition

Mindset

  • There is no â€œbestâ€ moment. Start right now.
  • Think of a big leaderboard. Every time you progress you score a point. Else you lose point. Can you become a top tier player?
  • Excuses are obstacles to overcome.
  • You donâ€™t need all the crap people tell you. Go out and grab what you want!
  • You can be a producer. Start to write!
  • Use music to manage your feelings.
  • Life is a game. You canâ€™t choose your character. But you can definitely improve him!
  • Pleasure and pain are temporary. The first will stop you. The latter will push you up.
  • Becoming the very best at one skill is way better than being average at a hundred skills.

Money

  • The Internet is your friend! Become a producer and sell.
  • Learn how to make money on the Internet.
  • Those who understand others will never be poor.
  • Time is money. You know it but never apply it.
  • Learn about business in general.
  • Consider having a side-hustle.
  • Every second spent learning how to sell is a second well invested.

Time

  • You only have so many hours per day. Everyone has the same number. Not everyone ends up with the same achievements.
  • Having a to-do list will help you.
  • Donâ€™t post picture of yourself on social media. You will lose time.
  • Donâ€™t check your friendsâ€™ social media. They will tell you another day.
  • Donâ€™t go out more than two nights per week. It will ruin you in the long run.
  • Every second waiting is a lost second.

Social

  • You are the average of the 5 friends you spend the most time with.
  • Donâ€™t make friends with people claiming that you are their friend. It never ends well.
  • Donâ€™t follow the trends. Make them.
  • Associate yourself with winners, they have more fun.
  • Some people are a time-hole. Avoid them.

entry.title: What are some cool psychological hacks?
entry.content:
What are some cool psychological hacks?

David Lewis, Self Employed

97.4k Views Â· 1.3k Upvotes

  • People who use hand gestures while talking can easily impress others.

  • Studies have shown that if you want to feel relaxed, you should try listening to loud or more extreme types of music.

  • People remember the first and last things you do, so make a good impression and end on a high note.

  • Canâ€™t stop a song from playing in your mind? Just try to memorize the ending of the song to break the loop once and for all.

  • When working with your boss or supervisor never ask â€œCan you do this for me?â€, always ask â€œCan you show me how to do this?â€

  • Want to boost your response time in an exam or Interview? Play some puzzle game before attending it.

  • Feeling depressed? Too much work pressure? Start to clean your room, Organize your desk, or your wardrobe. This will relax your mind and you will be able to focus better.

  • Using your non-dominant hand whenever possible can actually help make you more adaptable in a crisis. Certain studies have shown that using your non-dominant hand can make you be a more open-minded person, too!

  • If you want to get a positive response from someone, nod while you talk.

  • Psychology says you can boost your creative thinking by raising your eyebrows.

Thank you for reading:)

entry.title: What should one do at home during semester breaksï¼Ÿ
entry.content:
What should one do at home during semester breaksï¼Ÿ

Balaji Viswanathan, CEO at Invento (2016-present)

96.6k Views Â· 8.5k Upvotes

You should not be sitting at home during semester breaks. Teen period is the best time for you to do something good with your life. Every hour you waste in that time is equivalent to wasting 10 hours in a later time period.

  • I spent my 2nd semester break in one of Chennaiâ€™s largest libraries learning Java. I was also reading books like â€œHow to get whatever you wantâ€ to improve my business skills.

  • My 3rd semester break was spent in working with a professor on a project involved Neural Networks and Genetic Algorithms. I also did a lot of coding with algorithms from CLRS.

  • 4th semester break I spent in preparing for GRE [I had to write it early as people scared me about the new pattern that was coming that year]. Getting that monkey off my back early allowed me to fret less about what I will do after college.

  • 5th semester break went in preparing for ACM ICPC programming contest and going to Asia regionals in Dhaka.

  • 6th semester break went into working in a research project for which got IEEE student paper award.

  • 7th semester break was into working on a project that got me an entry into HPâ€™s Asian young inventors awards in Singapore.

  • 8th semester break was spent working as Summer Research Fellow at IISc.

Yes, this is a lot of bragging. Just to convince you how important is college life. There was not a single semester break I spent either at home or in travel. There were a lot of successful people I know who pretended as though they achieved without doing anything. I know how hard they worked and also how hard they worked to avoid you knowing how hard they worked.

And that hardwork really paid off that time. There was a time during college when a tech company invited me to be their Chief guest for their new office inauguration and I was much younger to all the people applying for a job there â€” originally the folks there cleared me off to the jobseeker queue until they realised I was the one inaugurating the program.

After graduation and joining work at my dream company, I spent a lot of time binge watching Netflix. That paid off too â€” as my career slowed down and hit a wall. My lifeâ€™s momentum dropped to zero. I had to once again bring the momentum back.

Every hour you spend at home or with TV during your younger years will come to bite you. Take up an internship to learn and contribute to the company. Their leaders will notice the new star. Or take up volunteering with a cause you most associate with and move the world a little closer to where you want it. Or take up a skill you could really master. Or work in a lab and really help your guide or other researchers to make their task easy [say collecting data, setting up experiments etc]. And read lots of books.

You could still ignore all this and sit infront of Netflix or watch the World Cup. That could help you lot recounting stories of regret to your children and grandchildren. The reason why your teachers and parents stress so much on this is because they know how painful it is to screw up their time and endup like that.

Get up and get out.

entry.title: What is the most effective way to see a person's true personality?
entry.content:
What is the most effective way to see a personâ€™s true personality?

Sean Lana, Bachelor Philosophy of Everyday Life, The College and University Experience (2025)

161.3k Views Â· 2.2k Upvotes

  1. Observe their spending habits. Do they spend money to collect moments or things? People that spend money on things would always buy stuff that they do not need, they are money wasters, stingy and not adventurous!
  2. Observe the way they treat common people out there, e.g. Beggars, homeless people, waitress, cleaners etc. You can use this to measure their level of sympathy and empathy.
  3. How do they talk about other people, do they mock, belittle and gossip about them? Such people cannot be trusted!
  4. During difficulties and challenges in life, observe their behaviour. Are they calm or do they let their emotion overwhelm them? Itâ€™s either the person has the confidence or lacks confidence!
  5. Anytime you are having a conversation with them: can they maintain eye contact or do they avoid eye contact?
  6. Do you have a friend that remembers you only anytime he or she needs your assistance? It is a sign that the person doesnâ€™t value a deep relationship and he or she is just using you.

entry.title: What are 10 simple habits that can change my life?
entry.content:
What are 10 simple habits that can change my life?

Malcolm Lemmons, Entrepreneur & Author (2017-present)

116.3k Views Â· 1.4k Upvotes

  1. Drink a glass of water immediately after you wake up.
  2. Read for at least 20 minutes everyday.
  3. Mediate or sit quietly for at least 10 min everyday.
  4. Say to yourself one thing that youâ€™re grateful for when you wake up everyday.
  5. Get some form of exercise for at least 30 min everyday.
  6. Tell someone you love them everyday.
  7. Rewrite your top three goals for the year everyday.
  8. Spend 10 min everyday writing down new ideas.
  9. Focus on eating healthier.
  10. Find joy in the simple things and laugh everyday.

â€œWe become what we repeatedly do.â€â€”â€”Sean Covey

entry.title: What should I start doing earlyï¼Ÿ
entry.content:
What should I start doing earlyï¼Ÿ

Rahul Shrivastava, Four decades of life experience

21.2k Views Â· 1.1k Upvotes

  • Start exercising regularly. Itâ€™s an investment. Your body will thank you for treating it well when you were younger. Better to spend more time in the gym than in the hospital.
  • Plan your life after retirement. Buy a health insurance plan early. Develop a skill, which will keep you occupied when you leave your job.
  • Start travelling. As your savings increase, you can explore places farther off. With age, your willingness and stamina to travel may decrease.
  • Learn to cook, drive and do household chores. You wonâ€™t have to depend on anyone.
  • Put aside a portion of your earning as saving. Youâ€™ll feel more confident to spend if you are prepared for the rainy day.

entry.title: What is the most clever life hack you've learned?
entry.content:
What is the most clever life hack youâ€™ve learned?

Naomi K, Answered Feb 12 Â· Upvoted by Frank Bell, Experienced Martial Artist, Held at Gunpoint

203.4k Views Â· 13.4k Upvotes

  1. Golden spending rule: If you canâ€™t afford two of it, you canâ€™t afford it.
  2. When youâ€™re thinking about buying something you donâ€™t necessarily need, imagine the item in one hand and the cash in the other. Which one would you take?
  3. Never loan a friend more than you can afford to give away.
  4. If a job makes you pay money to work for them, itâ€™s a scam.
  5. Want to find a good job after college? Make friends with as many people in your field that are on track to graduate one or two years ahead of you.
  6. Take a picture of business cards people hand you, just in case you lose them.
  7. Secretaries, tech support, and janitors are the true power in an office. Make friends with them and youâ€™ll be able to get anything you need!
  8. If you forget someoneâ€™s name simply say, â€œSorry, what was your name again?â€ They may look annoyed, but once they tell you their first name say, â€œNo, I meant your last name.â€
  9. The next time you stub your toe or get a cut, look away. The body oftentimes associates pain with sight.
  10. If you ever have to park in a city at night, park in front of a bank. Theyâ€™re lit up and have cameras everywhere.
  11. Tie a small piece of brightly colored fabric to your luggage. Youâ€™ll be able to spot your bag at the airport in no time!
  12. Hang a picture of a tattoo you want somewhere youâ€™ll see it every day for a year. If you still want it after that, then itâ€™s worth getting.
  13. Success is a state of mind. If you want success, start thinking of yourself as a success.
  14. If you are buying headphones or speakers, test them out with â€œBohemian Rhapsodyâ€. It has the complete set of highs and lows in instruments and vocals.
  15. Never be afraid to spend a little extra on a new bed and shoes. If youâ€™re not in one, youâ€™re in the other.
  16. When you feel like you need something, but you canâ€™t figure out what it is, itâ€™s water. Itâ€™s always water.
  17. Always under-promise and over-deliver. Most people tend to do the opposite.

entry.title: What habits do happy couples have?
entry.content:
What habits do happy couples have?

Rajmadan Sangumani, lives in Redmond, WA (2018-present)

109.1k Views Â· 4.7k Upvotes

We know each other for 12 years and happily married for 10yrs.

  1. First thing in the morning when we wake up we kiss and hug each other, itâ€™s like a bed coffee, continuing for 10yrs.
  2. Itâ€™s a daily routine. We both call each other in the morning to check whether we have reached our respective offices.
  3. Call in lunch-time to find out whether we had our lunch; not a single day missed without calling.
  4. She always cooks and I always clean, we never complained about this to each other.
  5. Wake up early on Weekends compared to weekdays, this will give a lot of time for both of us to spend together. Typically weekend starts with a long walk or long drive together.
  6. What may come, we ensure that we never leave each other and be alone for more than 2 weeks. We were lucky enough to follow this for last 10yrs.
  7. Friday night for sure we will watch one classic old Tamil movie together on TV. Always it would be a happy ending movie, so we go to sleep light-hearted and wake up the next day early with lots of positive energy.
  8. We respect our personal spaces and when one needs this space, we donâ€™t interfere.
  9. Our mobile phone password is known to each other and can even exchange our phones for the entire day. There is nothing called secrets.
  10. She is a Tea lover, I make fantastic tea to make her happy. I am a coffee lover and she is a fabulous coffee maker to make me happy. So we live by the quote â€œThe greatest happiness in the world is to make others happy.â€

These are everyday habits and these things develop over time automatically.

Just remember one thing: you have to make your partner a priority, put some effort into it, love partner for what they are and watch the magic unfold.

entry.title: What have you learned from your life till now?
entry.content:
What have you learned from your life till now?

Odedra Vijay, Updated Apr 5

56.2k Views Â· 2.5k Upvotes

  • The time from age 17 to 24 is the most important time in life. Your hard work in these seven years can make your whole life better.
  • Life without any planning will take you nowhere. A proper blue print will take you to greater heights.
  • Ambitions keep you alive. Few years of peaceful life will make you bored.
  • Living your life for someone else will make it meaningful.
  • Travelling is one of the ways to make your life exciting. Spending some bucks on travelling will definitely be the worth.
  • Failure is one of the most important aspects of life. Success tastes sweeter after failure.
  • Haters make you love your life more.

entry.title: What is your most powerful tip?
entry.content:
What is your most powerful tip?

Emily Clark, Supply Chain Manager at Aerospace Industry (2016-present), Updated Fri Â· Upvoted by Zi Heng Ng, Ph.D. Humanity & Life and Living, Earth (1994)

275.8k Views Â· 12.3k Upvotes

I am sharing the list of Most Powerful Life tips.

  1. When you donâ€™t want to check your bank account because you are afraid, you should definitely check your bank account.
